intro: Didymosalpinx konguensis, commonly known as the Konguensis didymosalpinx, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of India. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. The botanical features of Didymosalpinx konguensis make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
